main event: The report describes a sighting of a bluish-white irregular round object with two small satellites, observed briefly through binoculars by Air Force personnel at Chanute AFB, Illinois in September 1952.
interesting points: The object was approximately 10 times the diameter of neighboring stars and moved in a straight path before ascending and disappearing as if going behind a cloud.
It was seen for a duration of about 25 minutes, during which it disappeared and reappeared multiple times, with a decrease in brightness over time.
A local flying B-25 was requested to attempt interception, but the pilot dismissed the object as a reflection of a star on the clouds.
The weather consisted of thunderstorms in the west and light cirrus clouds in the east, and it was noted that clouds passed between the object and the observers on several occasions.
The report includes sketches depicting the flight path and position of the sighting relative to the horizon.
sighted object: bluish-white irregular round object with two small satellites
photographs: no the report does not include photographs
